Question Number: 14
Variable Label: Influence others vs no influence
Question Text: a.  in discussions about politics with friends and neighbors, i can influence the opinions of others?  b.  as far as politics are concerned, friends and neighbors do not listen to me
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 15
Variable Label: Government too complicated vs understand government
Question Text: a.  the way the government operates sometimes seems so complicated that i cannot really understand what is going on?  b.  i can usually understand the way that government works
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 16
Variable Label: Representatives listen vs don’t listen
Question Text: a.  as a community, we are usually able to make our elected representatives listen to our problems.  b.  we are usually unable to make our elected representatives listen to us
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 17
Variable Label: Voting doesn’t matter vs it improves lives
Question Text: a.  no matter who we vote for, things will not get any better in the future.  b.  we can use our power as voters to choose leaders who will help us improve our lives
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 18
Variable Label: Identity
Question Text: we have spoken to many [country]ns and they have all described themselves in different ways.  some people describe themselves in terms of their region, language, ethnic group, religion, or gender.  others describe themselves in economic terms, such as working class, middle class, or according to their occupation (e.g. a farmer or a housewife).  besides being [country]n, which specific group do you feel you belong to first and foremost
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 47 (responses 1-2)
Variable Label: Referendum about?       2

    Variable Label: ''

Question Number: 48A
Variable Label: Referendum same as election?
Question Text: a.  a referendum is the same thing as an election
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48B
Variable Label: Referendum must register?
Question Text: b.  to take part in a referendum in [country], it is first necessary to register as a voter
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48C
Variable Label: Referendum choose candidates?
Question Text: c.  in a referendum, voters choose candidates for political office
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48D
Variable Label: Referendum secret ballot?
Question Text: d.  a referendum does not have a secret ballot, so others will know how you voted
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48E
Variable Label: Referendum choose govt. system?
Question Text: e.  in [country]’s upcoming referendum, voters will choose a system of government for the country, including whether political parties can compete in elections
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48F
Variable Label: Referendum must abide results?
Question Text: f.  if citizens do not like the results of a referendum, they do not need to abide by them
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48G
Variable Label: Referendum changes constitution?
Question Text: g.  the results of the referendum require that changes be made to the constitution of [country]
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 48H
Variable Label: Referendum government resign?
Question Text: h.  if the voters in the referendum reject the movement system, the government will have to resign
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 49
Variable Label: Know SAP
Question Text: have you ever heard about the structural adjustment program (sap)
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 50
Variable Label: Satisfied SAP
Question Text: how satisfied or unsatisfied are you with the sap
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 51
Variable Label: People responsible for own well-being vs govt. responsible
Question Text: a.  people should look after themselves and be responsible for their own success in life.  b.  the government should bear the main responsibility for ensuring the well-being of people
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 52
Variable Label: Jobs by starting businesses vs govt. provides
Question Text: a. the best way to create jobs is to encourage people to start their own businesses.  b.  the government should provide employment for everyone who wants to work
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 53
Variable Label: Free to earn vs govt. limits
Question Text: a.  everyone should be free to earn as much as they can, even if this leads to differences in income between people.  b.  the government should place limits on how much rich people can earn, even if this discourages some people from working hard
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 54
Variable Label: Goods available vs low prices
Question Text: a.  it is better to have goods available in the market, even if the prices are high.  b.  it is better to have low prices, even if there are shortages of goods
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 55
Variable Label: Free schooling vs raise educational standards
Question Text: a.  it is better to have free schooling for our children, even if the quality of education is low.  b.  it is better to raise educational standards, even if we have to pay school fees
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 56
Variable Label: Civil servants keep jobs vs lay some off
Question Text: a.  all civil servants should keep their jobs, even if paying their salaries is costly to the country.  b.  the government cannot afford so many public employees and should lay off some of them
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 57
Variable Label: Government keeps factories vs privitization
Question Text: a.  the government should retain ownership of its factories, businesses, and farms.  b.  it is better for the government to sell its businesses to private companies and individuals
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 58
Variable Label: Economic reform too expensive vs accept hardships now
Question Text: a.  the costs of reforming the economy are too high; the government should therefore change its economic policies.  b.  in order for the economy to get better in the future, it is necessary for us to accept some hardships now
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 59
Variable Label: Trust generally
Question Text: generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you must be very careful in dealing with people
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 60A
Variable Label: Trust own ethnic group
Question Text: i am know going to read you a list of people and organizations.  how much do you trust each of them to do what is right?  a.  someone from your own ethnic group
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 60B
Variable Label: Trust other ethnic groups

Question Number: 66
Variable Label: All family members same opinion vs each decides
Question Text: a.  all members of a family should hold the same political opinions.  b.  every family member should be free to make up his or her own mind on political issues
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 67
Variable Label: Women equal rights vs follow traditional law
Question Text: a.  women in [country] should have equal rights and receive the same treatment as men do.  b.  women have always been subject to traditional african law, and should remain so
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 68
Variable Label: Women’s place at home vs speak about politics
Question Text: a.  a woman’s place is in the home; women should not try to speak out about politics.  b.  a women should exercise her right to speak out about politics, even if her husband disagrees
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 69
Variable Label: Women quota needed vs unnecessary
Question Text: a.  to ensure fair representation, we should continue to set aside 30 percent of elected positions for women in [country].  b. setting aside seats for women is unnecessary, since women should have to compete with men for the same elected positions
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 70
Variable Label: Women own land vs not own land
Question Text: a.  women in [country] should be allowed to buy, inherit, or co-own land.  b.  women in [country] should be prohibited from any kind of land ownership
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 71
Variable Label: Meaning of political party
Question Text: when you hear the term “political party,” what is the first thing that comes to your mind
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72A
Variable Label: Two political parties needed
Question Text: a.  at least two political parties are needed to provide people with real choices of leaders
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72B
Variable Label: Enough choice without parties
Question Text: b.  even without political parties, we already have enough choice among candidate for office
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72C
Variable Label: Parties needed to ensure representation
Question Text: c.  many political parties are needed to make sure that all points of view are represented in government
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72D
Variable Label: Parties don’t include me
Question Text: d.  political parties will not necessarily include me in political discussions and decisions
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72E
Variable Label: Parties ensure govt. doesn’t abuse power
Question Text: e.  political parties help to ensure that people in government don’t abuse their power
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72F
Variable Label: Parties make empty promises
Question Text: f.  in order to get elected, political parties simply make promises that they can never fulfill
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72G
Variable Label: Parties bring in young leaders
Question Text: g.  through political parties, young leaders will arise to replace older leaders who used to run this country
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: 72H
Variable Label: Parties undermine national unity
Question Text: h.  by causing conflict and confusion, political parties will undermine national unity
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''
